Reviews.Content: 2nd. visit just as nice as the 1st. This is my second stay, and it was just as great as the first. I stayed from June 13 until June 18, 2008. We stayed in a 2 bedroom this time as opposed to the 1 bedroom we stayed in last time. It was very quite, we were on the bottom floor, and only heard noise maybe one time from the unit above. And that was when they were running water. The staff was just as nice this time as they were a year ago when we were there. I would stay here again in a heart beat. As a matter of fact, we will be staying again in August 2008. Looking forward to it.
Reviews.Author: mymisfit

Reviews.Content: Fantastic location; quiet, spacious condo We stayed for a week in a two bedroom/two bathroom condo. We were a group of four adults. This is a quiet resort (at least it was in May). Our unit was spacious and clean. The kitchen was equipped with basics like dishes, cutlery and pots and pans. There were no mixing bowls, colander, etc. so it would be difficult to prepare a real meal but it was great for breakfasts, etc. The beds were comfortable and the linens/towels were of good quality. The pullout couch was not the best (apparently sagged in the middle). We had an attached garage which was extremely convenient, plus the car stayed nice and cool. The complex has a nice pool and hot tub, a small fitness center and a couple of computers with internet for public use. There was complementary coffee/tea/water in the clubhouse, plus newspapers and magazines. Canyonview backs on to the most amazing natural area, which is fantastic for hiking in the morning and looking at the stars at night. The location is excellent. Very close to Arizona Mills Mall and close (but not TOO close) to the highways to get one out town easily for day trips. There is a good grocery store (Fry's) nearby, plus there are several restaurants nearby (within 5 minute drive or 15 minute walk). All the staff were friendly and helpful. The complex and the neighbourhood seemed very safe. We had housekeeping service on the Wednesday of our week. I would say this place wouldn't be appropriate for people who want to party but we would stay here again in a heartbeat.
Reviews.Author: JWren

Reviews.Content: Worst experience in 25 years Where do I start? To find it, you drive through a business park area to find an older, 2-story converted condo complex in a remote area. There is no food service in the immediate area, no room service or maid service. Apparently there is also no security in the complex. My ground floor room had both a sliding glass door  regular door to the rear of the condo. I did not feel safe. For example, on the older sliding glass door, there was only a cheap flip lock with no drilled pin or even a safety bar. The screen door was off track  rusted. I was unable to pull it into the fully shut position. I was in a 1-bedroom condo, so yes there was more space than a regular standard hotel room. However, my room was dark  decorated in putty-like colors circa early 90's. The cement patio in the rear had no table or chairs to enjoy the outdoors. When I went to the front desk to tell the female clerk I wanted a safer second floor room, she informed me it was an upgrade and I would have to pay an additional $35 per night. I was shocked  stunned. As a woman traveling alone I never stay in hotels on the ground floor. In addition, I've never been told that I had to pay more money to achieve a basic sense of personal safety. Then when I thought it couldn't get any worse, I discovered there is no internet access in the room. Apparently the only internet access is in their office area. Both the hotel manager  desk clerk were unresponsive  indifferent to my concerns. For the first time in 25 years of business travel, I decided to check out after 30 minutes. I stayed at another hotel (Marriott) where I felt safe. Without a doubt, this was the worst so-called resort experience in 25 years of national travel. I would never have knowingly selected a property where I had to stay on the ground floor in an unsafe room or had no internet access. I selected the property based on the information on the Orbitz web site which stated both internet and wireless internet. I feel ripped off  duped. Because it was prepaid reservation Orbitz said too bad. The resort manager said we're taking your money, you prepaid. On the positive side, there did appear to be some desert hiking trails nearby. However, there was also a public parking lot at the entrance to the property, so you could enjoy the trails without having to stay at this disappointing property.
Reviews.Author: FemaleTraveller876

Reviews.Content: A great vacation We were just there the last week in Feburary 2008 and hope to return. Our accommadations were nice. (2 BR-2 Bath) The furnishings were older but okay. The weather was great so we did not nead the heating or air conditioning which was good as it was so loud when starting we left it off during the night. The staff was great! The pool area was very clean and quite. Excellent location! It was a little hard to find the first night due to poor lighting on the part of the city. With just a few minor touch ups and improvements Canyon View will be in very high demand.
Reviews.Author: stoshWi

Reviews.Content: Booked in advance and got the run around (Booked 3 months prior) Got checked into our room just before 7pm to find that the room had been missed for cleaning. (Yuck) Stuff everywhere, fecal matter in toilet...I'm sure you can imagine. When we went back to front desk, they told us that there were totally booked and that they would have to call the cleaning staff back in. By 9:45 pm, we still have no room and no cleaning staff had even arrived, so we told the front desk staff that we were considering looking around Phoenix to find another hotel. AFTER ALL THAT TIME, they said they could put us in a little bigger suite. (They were supposed to be fully booked.) Oh gee, thanks. The new suite was not very clean either but it worked fine. When I (very politely) talked to the manager the next day to see about compensation for the inconvenience (or even just an apology), he told us that we were welcome to stay elsewhere for the last two nights. Wow. Nice. Phoenix was one of the friendliest places that I have ever been. The people are so wonderful...except for the management at this resort!
Reviews.Author: Roxylor

Reviews.Content: somewhat disappointing After traveling clear across the country, we were disappointed with the difference in amenties and cleanliness compared to what was printed in the RCI book through which we booked our unit. The 2 bedroom unit is very spacious and the full size washer and dryer was awesome. However, the carpet was badly soiled, the pool was unable to be used because of a broken pump, the utensils and kitchen items was a mixed and incomplete hodgepodge. To get internet service, we had to go to the clubhouse all the time, no service in the units. First night neighbors stayed up all night loudly partying. What was disappointing, it seemed that our complaints really went nowhere, only handled by an on-site and very young staff. Hopefully after some attention to detail this will be a nice resort in a beautiful and convenient location.
Reviews.Author: unkejl

Reviews.Content: What an Awesome Surprise!!! Because of a sudden change in itinerary we made a reservation at Canyonview Resorts Club South Mountain Preserve from a 'last minute deals' website. What a pleasant surprise. The check in was very quick and easy. The rates were unbelievably reasonable and the room was impressive. Very clean, beautifully decorated with full kitchen, bath, walkin closet, flat screen TV and a very comfy bed. The staff was very friendly and informative. We had trouble connecting to the wireless for our laptop - that appeared to be just in our room since we could connect in the office.
Reviews.Author: sjwhatisl

Reviews.Content: Hotel/Condos' are OK - Staff are great We stayed here over Thanksgiving while visiting friends and family in Phoenix. Whilst the rooms leave something to be desired the staff here are excellent. The hotel is well situated to get to most of the surrounding attractions. Although the hotel appears to be going through some kind of expansion or renovation it should be nice when finished.I have to compliment the front desk staff. The girl that checked us in, Vicky, was so pleasant. She was helpful, gave us good information about the hotel and the surrounding areas and did everything she could to make our Thanksgiving a truly enjoyable experience. The afternoon girl was equally pleasant and helpful (sorry, I can't remember her name). If the rest of the staff are as good and committed as these girls seem to be then this place has a good future.We will probably return next time we are in town, if the refurb work is complete.
Reviews.Author: MegSanDiego

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel       Bedroom
Reviews.Author: Geeky23

Reviews.Content: Great price for a great condo       Bathroom
Reviews.Author: bestadvicechick

Reviews.Content: Very Disappointing Although I realise they are in the process of upgrading the property, I would NEVER visit there again. The buildings were lovely, spacious rooms but the renovations had been done on the cheap - eg: cheap MDF cupboard doors and interiors that are hard for housekeeping to keep clean, mismatched crockery and bent cutlery, a waste disposal that didn't work and most of all, when we went to use the oven (which was all stained and marked on the top - so obviously had not been replaced) it was absolutely filthy inside. The location of the property was terrible (in the middle of offices and places of work). There were very little evening activities and if one was interested in something such as dreamcatcher making - or the like - you had to sign up for it 48 hours in advance. On vacation, I don't always know what I'm doing or where I'm going to be 48 hours in advance. So, even although Aristar is changing it's name and upgrading to Mountainview, it hasn't upgraded it's accommodations as expected. Very disappointing!!
Reviews.Author: Eione

Reviews.Content: recent name change Canyonland Very nice place in transition from apartments to timeshare.Pool small  unheated but nice pool area  they are planning a 2nd pool.WIFI in club house w/guest computer to use also.Nice walking trail in ajoining mountains---resort is at end ofSanFranscio St. behind office bldgs  consists of 1-2-3 bedrooms some w/garages however it is still not complete.Units are nice size but very plain. Very convient to food storesfuel etc. i would stay here again
Reviews.Author: heidigirl

Reviews.Content: In all fairness..... This property is in transition from the Aristar Resorts to the Canyon View Resorts Club. I think it is a timeshare property now. We recently stayed there and found the size of the resort suite we stayed in was very large. We had a 2 bedroom/2 bath. The furnishings were quite bland but I took into consideration that the property is undergoing renovations. With that said, I found it fine for our use. It was clean, had good water pressure in the showers and a nice pool area as well as nice grounds. The front desk was helpful in answering questions. Overall, I was satisfied with the timeshare stay.
Reviews.Author: drefinnej

Reviews.Content: IF your looking for a hotel STAY AWAY! This is an apartment not a hotel. The rooms are large but terrible. They do not have high speed internet in the rooms. You do not get maid service. Rooms were unclean. I would strongly suggest to stay elsewhere.
Reviews.Author: sk1992

Reviews.Content: If you bought the timeshare, service suffers A family member had bought a timeshare with Aristar and suggested I book a week there when my out of town guests came to visit Phoenix. I took her up on her offer, she even made the arrangements for a 2 bedroom, 2 bath, condo for our stay there. When we showed up to get our room, we were told we had booked a 1 bedroom, 1 bath for four adults (women). I explained that was not correct and asked to speak to the manager. He looked at the reservation, and explained I was wrong. I advised him of the price I was quoted for the 2 BR, 2 BA and he told me I did not quote the correct amount and therefore the mistake was mine. The clerk standing by corrected him and explained that I was quoting the correct amount that I had been given when the reservation was made.When I again explained the error was on the resorts part, the manager asked me if I was accusing his staff of lying. I told him, No, his staff had made an error. Negotiations deteriorated from there, however, we were eventually given semi-acceptable accommodations, but not what we had originally requested.Apparently, there where several possible buyers coming in the next day, so many condos were reserved for the people who had not yet spent their money.We ended up with a condo next to a garage used as the laundry, maintenance room. Between 7:30-7:45 A.M., every morning, we woke to extremely loud music and conversation from the laundry roomI sent this complaint to Airistar when completing their survey and never heard a word from them since. I just happened upon Aristar this evening while making travel plans and felt I had to say, Buyer Beware.
Reviews.Author: keepmovinArizona

Reviews.Content: Love it Love it i would go back again and again.
Reviews.Author: pete2008

Reviews.Content: Lots of Space, Far From it All       Bathroom Sink Area
Reviews.Author: moviegal226

Reviews.Content: Beautiful and Quiet Nice resort in the middle of Phoenix. Close by everything yet set aside in a park preserve. The resort is going thru renovation yet the staff assisted us with everything we needed. I will return!
Reviews.Author: atwunder

Reviews.Content: Perfect We travel quite a bit and have stayed in Phoenix before at other hotels. This was a great change for us. The resort itself is peaceful, you can hear the birds chirp and squirrals run in the trees. You can hike right on site into the mountain preserve which we loved. The units are clean, beautifully decorated, flat screen TVs, great furniture, much more then most other places Plus, having a kitchen was a benefit for snacks and such, we saved money too! We had a much needed quiet and relaxing vacation. The staff was amazing, we will be back.
Reviews.Author: FamilyTripsSanDiego
